poem:
### Cheeky Greengrocer

A handful of posh birds,  
he scoffs—pinned  
in their own confines,  
like onions on the market stand.  
Jests cling, unwanted gleaners,  
as laughter bruises  
on sun-dappled skin.

In alley whispers, these birds  
sing louder, keener—  
for the market winds shift,  
unmasking the hollow guise.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Yes, the problem is men like Gregg Wallace – but it’s also those who should stop them and don’t | Gaby Hinsliff It was only a handful of “middle-class women of a certain age”. That’s how the MasterChef host Gregg Wallace originally dismissed his accusers, when allegations of sexually inappropriate behaviour first surfaced. Just a few humourless posh birds, in other words, who couldn’t take a joke from the self-styled “cheeky greengrocer” and star of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
